transcript.text: Nature is a beautiful scope of the earth

here to talk about a marvelous spectacle

organisms too small to be seen by the
naked eye. These bacterialsized
organisms, or more appropriately termed
microorganisms, live as cells within the
tissues of plants and are called endoes.
An endoyte, simply put, is a fungal
microorganism that resides in the living
tissues of plant species in a
mutualistic relationship with that
plant. What this means is is that they
live in a relationship where they both
give to and take from the plant in a
sort of unspoken deal. What they offer
to the plant is protection from
pathogens, which is a fancy term given
to microorganisms that are capable of
causing sickness and disease. What they
also do is help facilitate the uptake of
essential nutrients from the environment
and can promote growth and development
in the plant. what they receive in
return. It's just a nice environment
where they can carry out their life
cycle and grow. Although this is all

is their capabilities in metabolizing
the same products as a host plant. In

the plant can produce, the endoight can

plants that produce antibacterial
products. As such, endopidic research
has become an increasingly important

promoted to metabolize their products.
These products are then extracted from
the ideal environment where they'll be

any that do exhibit antibacterial
activity can be used by scientists to

As I said before, using the
